title: Patient Management System
description: This was a significant project where I deployed a microservices-based hospital system using technologies like AWS Bedrock, Java Spring, Kafka, and PostgreSQL. The core objective was to replace an inefficient manual paper-and-pen system.
results: The result was dramatic: the new system lowered documentation time by 60% and improved retrieval time by an impressive 380Ã— during a parallel run experiment.
features: Architecture designed for scalability and security
Role-based access, gRPC communication, and containerized services
Backend orchestrated with Java Spring and Kafka
Centralized dashboard managing over 12 data streams
On-demand status checks, appointment overviews, prescription printing, and tracking of blood tests and doctor notes

title: Kairos
description: Kairos utilizes a custom RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) pipeline built with React Native, Google Cloud, and AWS Bedrock. The goal was to make course information instantly accessible to students.
features: Pipeline transforms unstructured PDF syllabus documents into a structured format
Enables students to ask questions about their classes in natural language
Custom integration between syllabus documents, Canvas, and Google Calendar
Automatically schedules assignments using smart-scheduling logic
Tracks completion, reducing time students spend on tracking coursework by 20%
